str2: A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
Rightly. Adverb from orthos; in a straight manner, i.e. correctly.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
